Reviews.Title: “Perfectly wonderful in every way!”
Reviews.Author: trippinlisa
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in the very accessible Marleybone (and close to 2 Tube stops) this charming boutique hotel is distinguished by its gracious British service. From the front desk staff to the young women serving breakfast, they did everything humanly possible to provide us with an inviting and comfortable stay. The breakfast is worth taking, with a lovely fresh buffet of delicious breads, fruit, all the extras and eggs made to order that you can enjoy in a charmingly British lounge overlooking a quaint street. They'll serve you from their little well-stocked bar any time day or night and help with any other requests. We stayed on the top floor (there is some street noise from a block away, but after the first night we didn't notice it) which does involve a 4 flight hike, but this is easily tolerated. This little gem of a hotel took the edge off the discomforts of travel - we certainly will return!

Reviews.Title: “All the basics done well”
Reviews.Author: tvjr
Reviews.Content: Friendly service, but not intrusive. Room was small, but that's expected in Central London. Very clean. Proper coffee, tea and water all complimentary. Comfy bed. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality unrivalled in London”
Reviews.Author: ever2n
Reviews.Content: By far and away, the friendliest, most helpful and efficient team of people, I have ever come across on my travels. Being a boutique hotel, it makes you feel you have met friends rather than employed staff. Thank you, Michael and all the guys for a memorable,comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique hotel find”
Reviews.Author: Bishan
Reviews.Content: This review is overdue, but when one looks back and misses the place they have been, the feedback is one that is better late than never. I was with my 8 year old for a holiday and this wonderful hotel was home during our UK trip on 2 occasions. It is central and close to Euston / Paddington. Yet located in a quiet road, with easy reach to basic food and services. Oxford Street (Selfridges side) is a pleasant 7 min walk. The hotel is tastefully furnished. We chose the Comfy Room which was cosy and the details such as choice of toiletries, beverages in the rooms, bedding standards just reflect the quality behind the style. But the heartbeat must be the personal service that made us feel at home, safe and taken care of. Whether it is the earnest receptionist who (without asking) helped with the luggage, or the attentive staff at the breakfast table, it is these efforts and thoughts that go such a long way in reminding we made a right accommodation choice, and more importantly making the holiday so memorable. Thank you, Montagu Plc. We hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneCazza
Reviews.Content: Very nice small hotel in an excellent location. We had a room on 3rd floor and lots of steps but the staff where very efficient in bringing our luggage to our room. The room was a nice size but a very small but adequate bathroom. Would have been nice to have a small bar fridge in the room. We were exhausted on our arrival after a long flight from Australia and we ordered some Thai recommended by the hotel staff which was delivered promptly to the hotel. The staff member (sorry, I cant remember names) made up a table for us and we received a complimentary glass of wine to enjoy with the meal which was delicious. We were visiting London to surprise our son on his 40th birthday and the night of the birthday party we were asked to baby sit our 4 yr old grandaughter so we took her back to the hotel and asked for a mattress or fold up bed for her. We waited but it never arrived so that was the only disappointing part of our 2 night stay in the hotel. We hadn't requested it earlier as we didnt know we would have her with us so it was perhaps too late in the evening to find one for her.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is a bother”
Reviews.Author: busybeesbiz
Reviews.Content: Nothing is a bother for the staff at this place, from getting an ironing board, to an umbrella, to flagging a taxi from the main street and mineral water after an obvious shopping trip. They are just so quick off the mark to attend to your needs. It is really one plus factor to stay at this place. There are no lifts in the hotel but the staff will help you with your bags. I had the basement unit which was larger than the upstairs units, but still amply heated. Free wifi is a plus as is late night dinner which can be served because they tie up with a Thai restaurant. The hotel has no gym but they have vouchers to a nearby one. It's 3 bus stops from Marble Arch and just one from Baker Street station. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “stay spoilt by other inconsiderate guests”
Reviews.Author: cdl3
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this hotel but was bitterly disappointed. We usually say at the Hilton but its prices were a little too high this time. I had booked a comfy room but was upgraded to a fancy room number 14 on the first floor. I cannot really fault the room, clean, complimentary water, tea and coffee, free wifi and lovely bed linen. I did find the mattress a little hard for my taste but the pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom was small but well appointed. We were facing the street but traffic noise wasn't a problem. The real problem was from the inconsiderate male guests above us who woke us up after midnight and kept us awake until gone 2.00am with their talking and laughter. I know the hotel is in a listed building but it really would be good if the owners could consider better sound proofing the rooms. My husband had business meetings the following day and was not feeling in the best frame of mind after the disturbed night. We reported our disappointment to the receptionoist at check-out (we had decided not to stay the second night) and she immediately gave us a 50% rebate on the second night, the cost of which was fully reimbursed by the manager when he came on duty the following day. I am sorry to buck the trend of the reviews for this hotel but unfortunately we cannot choose our fellow guests.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: katkat-1983
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Montagu Place Hotel in February and it is the perfect place to stay for a shopping and sightseeing trip to London. I can tell as I have been to this area in several hotels and the Montageu is far the best. I can also recommend it for Business Travellers as there is free WiFi access in the whole Hotel. The metrostartion is just around the corner and you can walk to Selfrides in max 5 minutes. All shops and a lot very nice small resturants are just aound the corner. The rooms are very quiet which is unusal in this area. I have to point out the staff as they have been the most friendly and proffessional I have ever met. Also the style of the hotel is what I would call the perfect Boutique Hotel - stylish but very cosy. The size of rooms are for London standards ok but might be small to someone who does not know that big rooms are unreasonable expensive...We had the standard room, but if you stay longer than a few days I would suggest to book one of the executive rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AmandaNeath
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our three nights stay. The hotel is very nice and the staff are friendly and eager to please. We had breakfast as it was included in our booking deal. However, had we had to pay extra I would have been rather disappointed! I am quite happy with continental breakfasts, but as mentioned by a previous reviewer the jams, cheeses etc were all catering style pre-packed offerings! It would have been nice to have had the choice of some fresh British cheeses. One other negative - on the second evening I opened a bottle of the, thoughtfully provided, complimentary water and found it was the previous days empty which had been re-filled with tap water! I did report it and the lovely young man at reception was most apologetic and provided me with a replacement. I would put this down to, maybe, a little laziness on the part of whoever serviced our room that day This does sound rather negative, but in fact we really enjoyed our stay and would return. The hotel is clean, comfortable and in an excellent location. The staff are friendly and eager to please. We stayed in a comfy room and it was plenty big enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good as ever”
Reviews.Author: BartyCrouch
Reviews.Content: Whilst having arranged for my folks to stay here when it first opened, my recent two nights here was the first time that I got to lay my head down myself. Whilst prices have inevitably gone up since it opened, there's no denying that this remains one of the nicest boutique hotels in the capital. The small touches were evident throughout - a proper cafitiere in the room with biscuits and water, mid-size Molton Brown products and excellent linens. I think that I had the same room as the poster below and whilst it was very small, was cosy and perfectly adequate for me. I too would advise against breakfast and head round the corner to Canteen as they do a decent eggs benedict and rhubarb compote for breakfast. Service is charming and they could not do enough to help (even ducking out in the pouring rain to hail me a cab to the airport). Now into the price bracket of some of the plush larger chains, but I would still make every effort to stay here when I am back. Location is absolutely superb. Short walks to the park and to Oxford Street and very close to the superb Galvin de Luxe bistro.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Nice”
Reviews.Author: elizsil
Reviews.Content: I read that the rooms were small so booked a Swanky room and was glad I did as even this room was not overly large. It was well appointed, however, with complimentary water, fruit and tea and had both a bath and a shower (the bathroom could have used a few more towels though). The location is great--a short cab ride from Paddington and close to Baker Street and its tube stop. The staff are incredibly nice, warm and helpful but they are from outside the UK so English skills and local knowledge vary. The reception area doubles as the bar so liquid refreshment--both alcoholic and non--is available around the clock. The breakfast, however, was sad--lots of packaged foods so I would recommend going around the corner to Canteen on Baker Street instead. The experience was very homey and personal and the Montagu is a good choice for those interested in small townhouse hotels. (like many hotels in this category this is probably not a good choice if stairs are a problem).

Reviews.Title: “Really nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flyingknee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my wife. Great location, walking distance from Marylebone and Baker St. stations and within easy travelling distance to most of London's sites, but far enough from the main roads to ensure that the local bars and restaurants weren't full of tourists (would recommend the Bee Hive pub and Ishtar Restaurant). Staff are exceptionally polite and helpful . Most surprising was how quiet it was, we had a room on the top floor facing the back and we never heard a sound at night. Minor criticism was that our room was quite small

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Simmobrizzy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located if you want the west side of London - a short cab ride (£7) from Paddington and the Heathrow Express and an 8 minute walk to Baker Street Tube. When we checked in we had a choice of a room on the 1st floor or one in the basement which didn't sound great but was in fact a much bigger room and the one we took. Neither room was huge, but this is London! The bathroom was small but modern, spotless and well equipped with Molten Brown toiletries. Comfortable bed, flat-screen TV, complimentary tea, coffee and water. Did not have breakfast so can not comment on this aspect. Sounds ok so far, but what sets this place apart from the pack is the service - the staff are simply brilliant. They are courteous, friendly and very helpful. If you need the internet, they lend you a laptop. If you need a restaurant they give you some suggestions and print out a map. They take care of your luggage and generally nothing seems to be too much trouble. It's a small boutique-style hotel where the personal service makes it a stand-out.

Reviews.Title: “What a staff!”
Reviews.Author: marcofedostiani
Reviews.Content: Four wonderful days in London in the right place. Central locations in a quite street but close to everything. The closest Metro station is at 5 minutes walk far in Baker street and the area is full of good, nice restaurant good for any taste. The staff is superb, ready to try to help you for any kind of problem, you can really feel as you are at home, Thanks from all of us

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Glassman77
Reviews.Content: Arrived late after dinner with friends but were promptly let in and taken up to our room - 33 on the top floor - perhaps not recommended if you are either pregnant or unfit. Small room but well set out and very nicely decorated. Very comfortable bed. Good double-glazing kept out the noise from the street. Good bathroom (powerful shower) with nice products. Breakfast was a bit disappointing. Had to ask twice before the waitress took our order for eggs and coffee. Eggs, when they arrived, we rubbery and tasteless. Otherwise, continental breakfast was good. Overall, a good location for us - 10 minutes from Marylebone station - and a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: Abbey C
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic weekend at Montagu Place, service was excellent from all the staff. Checking in was made so easy - sipping on a glass of champagne. Room was lovely and will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in Marylebone; underwhelming staff.”
Reviews.Author: jonesing
Reviews.Content: We were at the Montagu Place the week before Christmas, and it was a great little hotel. Very clean, the room was surprisingly large for London, and the amenities were fine -- free bottled water in the room and continental breakfast in the morning. My one disappointment was that the staff did not seem all that knowledgable about the city (or even the neighborhood). Simple questions like "How long will it take to get from A to B by tube" required a google maps search. When asked about pubs nearby that would be serving food after 9, another google search. Where's the nearest Barclays? A google search, even though the answer was literally, one block away. Even a question about the Heathrow shuttle from Paddington had to be researched. It became a joke between my husband and me...what *do* they know? So, while the hotel itself is fine...if you don't know London at all, I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: MAJ_Dave44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel together with some friends. The location is good; the staff was extraordinarily helpful; and we found the room to be well equipped, modern and comfortable. We plan to use this hotel in the future as a base for visiting London in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel. Boutique.”
Reviews.Author: RajBansal
Reviews.Content: Went here in February 2010. Amazing place in a great location. Search around on laterooms and booking.com to get a very decent price if you book in advance. Very stylish and cool place to visit. You are close to a number of tube stations which means you can get around everywhere in London very easily. Definitely book onto here and stay here for a few days if you're visiting London!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for the price in London”
Reviews.Author: jmt1983
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just completed three nights at the hotel and it was fantastic. The location is close to Baker St tube and Oxford St. The service is top notch and even the 'lower-level' comfy room we were in was an excellent size. The only slight (and it was VERY slight) complaint would be that the pillows didn't give the support I needed and I had a stiff-neck. But I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good relaxed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris2672
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for a long weekend. The staff were excellent, friendly and always offering help. We had room 33 which was very nice, plenty of room for us, and quiet. The breakfast was plenty and worth paying the extra for. The location was great, within a very nice area of London, plenty of places to eat and drink within a short walk. Even late evening you felt safe walking around. Would return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: shelbyparker
Reviews.Content: it is really nice to find something really nice yet reasonably priced in london. nothing not to like. have spent many a good night here, and also have used it frequently for corporate purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky in London”
Reviews.Author: LauMah
Reviews.Content: I hate red eye flights and I wanted a posh place to sleep when we arrived. I also wanted good value. This hotel is what I was able to find. Loved the room-modern, supercomfortbale beds, cute neighbourhood, not too far from the Tube (5min walk if you walk fast). Slept like a baby. Great bathroom. I don't know what I was thinking when I requested the Swanky room though. We don't need a lot of space. This room was North American size. I should have saved my money and went a bit smaller. If you love your space though, go swanky.

Reviews.Title: “Staff great, but hotel a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: will b
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Number Sixteen, I was hoping for the same quality experience at Montagu Place. The location is great and the staff are so friendly and helpful. However the rooms lack flair and hotel lacks atmosphere. The continental breakfast was the biggest disappointment and was more like the type of breakfast you'd expect in a Holiday Inn Express. We won't return and we couldn't recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: Nelly A
Reviews.Content: The hotel sells itself as being flexible. And flexible it is. We traveled with our toddler and thus had several requests that were ALL met swiftly, efficiently and without the slightest hint of showing extra effort or confusion. We asked for: early check-in for at least one of our two rooms. We got both at 11 am, 5 minutes after we had arrived. We asked for early breakfast downstairs. We got it both days, without even requesting it the second time. They had expected we would be waking early again... We asked for a late check-out. They granted that as well - no extra fees. Their cot-bed was clean and almost new. And they magically found a high-chair for breakfast (they did not have one to begin with but they proved to be very resourceful once again). The hotel is clean, tidy, most of the fittings look new and polished. The decor is light and clean. It seems like a smart venture - there is a fridge but it's empty - you can ask them to fill it in with whatever you want prior or during your stay, but basically, you don't have to deal with the horrific absurdity of minibar charges. A Tesco and a Waitrose are literally a 3 minute walk from the hotel anyway... Their Swanky rooms are quite a good size for London hotel rooms, so I would strongly advise booking one of those, even though they are the priciest on their list: we paid 245 pounds per night (which is not that expensive for London) but it was completely worth it because the room came with a big bathroom and it connected with our toddler's Comfy room (perfect for kids or one person but too small for a couple) on the first floor. If you're looking for a nice boutique hotel that is clean, accommodating to your needs and centrally located, then Montagu Place is it. We're definitely coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, lovely and fully recommendable”
Reviews.Author: TMitz
Reviews.Content: I am quite picky when it comes to Hotels. Quick and dirty accommodation makes any stay a disaster for me, even for a short trip. I am travelling quite a few times for working reasons but also private trips. I absolutely hate those empty hotel rooms you are only enthusiastic about when you are leaving again. Of course all of them provide a bed, a shower and maybe a table as well. It is not about pure luxury (which is not bad of course, anyway) but decisive are some lovely details, proving that the hotel really welcomes you, a nice attitude and things which make me feel welcome in some way. Well, cleanlyness and stuff like that, I should not have to mention anyway. To cut a long story short, Montagu Place Hotel, fully fulfilled my expectations. Rooms are nicely furnished and gave me a warm and welcoming feeling. Montagu offers amenities like complementary WLAN, Molton Brown toiletries, complementary tea, coffee or water and things like that. Staff is really helpful and friendly, strictly positive words from me regarding this point. To wrap it up, Montagu Place will definately stay on my London accommodation list. You won't find many other hotels in London offering such a comparably nice place and so much value for the money on the other hand as well. Without looking at the price, this hotel is a top pick for me, because it is a lovely place simply - and bringing in the price theme, it still keeps being one.

Reviews.Title: “A real delight”
Reviews.Author: RLOPkgQueen
Reviews.Content: My company booked me into a "comfy" room (Montagu's terminology) for a week's stay while I was in London on business. I had stayed a couple of months ago in the same general area at the Sherlock Holmes Park Plaza which wasn't nearly as nice. The Montagu felt like a very posh apartment house. My room was comfy and perfect size for one. I think it might be a bit crowded for a couple but would be doable. The bed was gloriously comfortable. All of the staff was so friendly and overly accomodating. I enjoyed sitting in the common area drinking a glass of wine in the evening. Breakfast was included in my corporate rate so I took advantage of that, not sure if it would be worth the extra otherwise since there are numerous coffee shops around. It is a really convenient location very near the Baker Street Tube Station and the Marylebone Rail Station. Both very quick walks away. I traveled by tube or rail all week and always felt safe going to and from either station. I was surprised how quiet my room and the hotel in general was. I had lucky room #13 so just a short flight of stairs. There is no elevator so higher floors might be a bit of a struggle for some people. The staff happily carried your luggage up & down. Like I said, I was there on business but think it would be a great place for couples too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: TripInIt4U
Reviews.Content: Picking a hotel in London can be a hit and miss experience. However here we hit the jackpot! Upon arrival we were informed that they had upgraded us to the best room in the house, the 'swanky' room is just that - enormous bed and fantastic bathroom. All the staff were excellent and we cannot fault anything about our experience. I wanted a special place to stay and our only regret is that we didn't have time to stay longer and enjoy this boutique gem. MAny thanks to Luca and all the staff and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: kiwisontour
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with this boutique hotel in Marylebone. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly- nothing was too much trouble.The room we found very comfortable , was tastefully decorated and of a good size for London. We found the location very central , quite enjoying the stroll to the undergound stations or wherever we needed to go. It was a superb location for reastaurants with a large selection within easy walking distance. We enjoyed the breakfasts and were very happy with the range of food on offer. The breakfast staff too we found friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: coloko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montagu Place for an extended weekend. The staff is very friendly and helpful and always eager to please. But if you want to be left alone, this is also possible. The hotel suffers a little from the standard London hotel flaws: small rooms, not perfectly cleaned (don't look too close at the carpets), stairs could be wider, etc. We found our bed to be too small, but the mattress is comfortable. We were told that the more expensive rooms have larger beds (recommended for people more than 1,8m long). Our overall impression, however, is that this is indeed a very good hotel, even more so in comparison to many other London hotels. Staff attitude is very good, much better than I have experienced in many places. The location actually is very convenient, within walking distance of several tube stations (we mainly used Baker Street, but Marylebone, Edgware Road and Marble Arch are within walking distance). There are several restaurants and pubs in the neighbourhood that serve reasonable food.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: aslopes
Reviews.Content: Due to its location only a short walk from the Baker Street Station (Sherlock Holmes, anyone?), this beautifully decorated boutique hotel is convenient to most London attractions. The room was cozy, clean and well-appointed, the bathroom a bit small but adequate. The hotel does lack an elevator. I did not find this to be a problem, but it could be an issue for someone with ambulation problems. I never ate breakfast at the hotel, but the spread seemed very nice. There is no restaurant on-site, but the hotel has partnered with a nearby Thai restaurant which serves very good and reasonably-priced food. There are also many cafes and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Aside from its elegant and pleasing aesthetic, the other strength of this hotel was its helpful, gracious, pleasant staff and manager; service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy boutique hotel at the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: SchueyMalaysia
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel after many days of researching and reviewing of the various traveler's feedbacks (not only at Tripadvisor but also at other travel websites). This hotel seem to received high recommendation consistently, so I decided to give it a try and I couldn't have made a better decision! The location - Initially, I was concern about its location (when viewed from google map, it looked a little "remote"), particularly with regards to safety issues (our trip took place just a week after the London riot). But alas, my concerns were all allayed. The hotel is located just 7 - 8 min. from the Baker Street station, which has good links to various parts of the city. It is also only a mere 10 min. walk to Oxford street or 5 - 6 min. walk to the lovely Marylebone High Street. Even though the hotel is located at a very quiet area, the surrounding area is well lit & we felt very safe on a couple of occasions when we walked home from the restaurant or tube station, after 10pm. The service - One of the best I've ever experienced. Very warm, friendly and responsive staff. There was nothing that they wouldn't do to make our stay a comfortable one - they printed out road maps for us, recommended restaurants, walk down the street to get us the taxi (one needs to walk some distance to get a taxi, as our hotel is not located along a main road, but the hotel staff always managed to find them with little effort though) etc. Only tiny comment is, when I made the reservation, I told them that we were there to celebrate our 11th year wedding anniversary. They took note of it but did not go the extra mile to do anything special for us. It would have made a lot of difference, even if they had given us just a simple welcome & congrats note. The room - We arrived early on the check-in day (at 10am). Our room was not ready yet (as expected), and we were offered to have some coffee while they get our room ready. But we decided to leave our luggage at the lobby and take a walk along Marylebone High Street. We received a call from the hotel at 11.15am, to inform us that the room was ready! After a long flight, it was good to be able to check in early to freshen up. As for the room, we stayed at Swanky room, which was the largest room available. The room was located at the top floor (3rd floor). As the hotel doesn't have lift, the climb is not exactly easy. We did not mind as we thought the exercise would be good for us, but I think this can be a deterrent factor for certain guests. I would suggest that you make specific request for lower floor room, if need to. However, the upside of staying at the top floor is - our bathroom comes with sky roof! Is was awesome! The room & the bathroom were large, clean, modern (minimalist style), just like what was shown in the hotel website (as we all know, some hotel's website photos might be deceiving). The bed was very, very comfortable and I rested very well every night. I am a light sleeper and really appreciated the fact that the street was quiet and the rooms have thick wall, so we could hardly hear any noise from neighboring rooms. However, I did find some very, very minor issues with the room: 1) There are only THREE hooks in the entire bathroom. So, there is not even sufficient "slots" to hang the 2 bathrobes and 2 bath towels. Therefore, my husband and I constantly struggled to find space to put our clothing, face towels etc. 2) There is very limited counter top space. Again, my husband and I faced substantial challenges in finding (dry) space to put our toiletries. 3) the ipod / iphone (?) docking machine didn't seem to work well with my iPhone. Maybe it was meant only for iPod, but it worked on the 1st day, so I don't know why it failed on me later on. I did not bother to complain as it was a small matter for me. It managed to charge my phone though. If you want a hotel with all the amenities like gym, swimming pool, restaurants etc., then this is not for you. But if you want a value for money, high quality boutique hotel, with a home away from home feel, you have found the right place!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, little gem!”
Reviews.Author: LW23
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel after moving out of the nearby Thistle Marble Arch (which was a disaster!!) and it proved to be a great choice. Even in the basement level room I found comfort, cleanliness and peacefulness. It is a boutique hotel where they value the customer and are willing to take an extra step to accommodate all your wishes. I can only say good things about it - it is nicely decorated, clean and comfortable. Staff is always nice and ready to help. I was extremely satisfied with the well-equipped room and bathroom with all the amenities I needed. The only inconvenience was that it is about 15 min walking distance from the closest tube station and there are not many restaurants or bars around. Montagu Place is a nice street in quiet residential area hence it lacks in any major nightlife attractions. Having said that, if that does not bother you, you should definitely choose this fantastic hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “a little gem in a great location, beats the chain hotels hands down”
Reviews.Author: Netherby
Reviews.Content: As part of celebrating my husband's 50th birthday we were looking for a small hotel in a great location. The Montagu did not disappoint. The staff were very friendly and flexible and really made our experience feel like a home from home. We booked a swanky room - (room 12) first floor. We had 3 double doors which extended from the bathroom through to the bedroom that led to a small balcony - really beautiful, especially on the morning of our trip where the sun was shining brightly. The bed is enormous and comfortable; all the small touches are taken care of - moulton brown toiletries were appreciated and the bathroom had a great shower and lovely free standing bath. Also the tea and coffee making facilities used high end brands and to have your own cafetiere with freshly ground coffee was a first for me. My only small piece of advice is that the breakfast whilst only £10 is ok but I'd avoid the offer of the eggs - they are only scrambled in the microwave and taste pretty bad - the lady serving looked frightened at the thought of my request for poached eggs, that should have been my hint. Do not let this though put you off - it is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “If Carslberg did boutique hotels.....”
Reviews.Author: BiriBolly
Reviews.Content: Stayed there the night before my wedding. I can honestly say that the staff couldn't have been more welcoming and friendly. They even paid for my taxi drivers tip because I didnt have enough money on me! The rooms are maybe a tad small but for the price well worth it. Breakfast was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home @ Montagu Place”
Reviews.Author: nuggettdog
Reviews.Content: Having just returned to Australia (8weeks away) we want to take the opportunity of saying how much we enjoyed Montagu Place Hotel. We arrived early a.m. but checking luggage in and leaving was not a problem. Problem is a word this hotel does not use. We would ask "where to eat", "how do I get too", "do you have a power adaptor" or "do you have a cold bottle of wine or beer", never a problem. Breakfast was always excellent for a boutique hotel, fresh croissants, hot rolls, fresh pastries and eggs anyway you would like. Cheese, cold meats and plenty of fresh fruits and compotes were available. As were in Montagu for 10 days we opted for a larger Swanky room and this was serviced well and placed in the front of the hotel on the 1st floor. On returning to the hotel of an evening it was lovely to be welcomed back warmly. Thank you Montagu Place staff for a great stay in London and hopefully we will be back for Wimbledon again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with perfect staff”
Reviews.Author: Thais77
Reviews.Content: When I made the reservation for 2 nights at the Montagu Place there were only comfy rooms left, which are really small, though nicely decorated, with a very comfortable bed, excellent shower and a good hairdryer (not usual in hotels). I was able to notice our next door room (# 22) was much larger and that would be my choice for a next time visit. You get the sensation of being in a private house rather than in a hotel. It’s located in a quiet neighborhood, and still not far from Oxford Street (10-15 minute walk) and a 5-10 minute walk to Baker Street tube station. Breakfast was delicious… I still dream about those freshly baked croissants! The staff members couldn’t be more professional, courteous and polite. Great option in London!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: IanSheffield
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a trip with friends visiting the sights. A little more expensive than we usually pay for, but felt like we got value. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, and made a real effort to make us welcome and help with anything - we were only there for one night, but felt welcomed and valued. Rooms were comfortable, with good facilities. A decent location. Nice to be in a small hotel where you got the impression the customers mattered, rather than a large chain where you usually feel lost in the machine. Overall, worth the extra money it cost.

Reviews.Title: “Small, well located, boutique hotel & an enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: yungkara
Reviews.Content: Let's get the only real negative out of the way first - there is no lift, but the good news - there are stairs! Montagu Place is 2 London town houses amalgamated into one so best to remember which one you are in when you return as, being on the top floor (3rd) you have two staircase options and one of them didn't lead to my room. I had been warned on check-in and also received an apology for no lift. My room was a "fancy" room - their nomenclature not mine. It means it's bigger than a comfy room and has a queen rather than a double and is at the front of the hotel rather than the back or lower ground. It had all the features you would expect of somewhere 4 star rated. The room was clean but missing the crispness. Carpet and paintwork were the teeniest bit tired - let's say just in the yawning stage. Shower room was small so it's either you or the door, but towels were fluffy and products were all nice quality. There's a big bowl of apples when you come through reception and plenty of complimentary hot drink choices in your room. Wifi is free and works well. I arrived in London by train but parking looks pretty tight and sewn up by the local residents, but there must be a pay car park not too far away if you have a car. the centre of London's shopping universe - Oxford Street, is but a 5 minute walk away. Paddington Station was a 10 minute cab ride away after I arrived their from Heathrow on the very fast express train. I didn't opt in for breakfast but took a 5 minute stroll around the corner where there were plenty of eating options. Had dinner at nearby Galvins Brasserie which was relatively expensive but nice atmosphere and very good. Staff at the Montagu are very pleasant and welcoming and I enjoyed my two nights there leaving relaxed and revived. Is it good value for money? I suppose it is given the rapacious rates many London hotels charge.

Reviews.Title: “A really lovely hotel - a complete gem in central London”
Reviews.Author: DaisySleight
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I stay in hotels regularly with our jobs so we were looking for something different for us for my birthday weekend. This is a really good hotel, although it doesn't feel like a hotel, more like you are staying in a very lovely private house. The staff were so welcoming and helpful, the room, we had a cosy room on the first floor, was clean, nicely decorated with top end toiletries, freshly ground coffee, free wifi and a very comfy bed. Location is excellent, just a short walk from Oxford Street. I would definitely stay here again for any trips to London whether business or pleasure. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Easily the nicest people I've ever met.”
Reviews.Author: Soverton
Reviews.Content: The staff here are THE NICEST! They can answer literally any question from, "where should we eat?" to, "where's the closest H&M?". They take care of everything while remaining respectful and professional. I love everyone who works here! The room was a nice, cozy size especially for just me and my mom. The neighborhood is quiet but also close to Oxford Street and other cool things within walking distance (like an H&M!). But, again, the staff is what really makes this hotel an extraordinary find. Also may I suggest, if you have some spare time during your stay, have a quick chat with the general manager or another staff member. Not only are they the nicest people ever, but they've got some amazing stories to tell and they're wonderful to just hang out with. Also, free wifi...just saying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent excellent excellent”
Reviews.Author: traveller11nNYC
Reviews.Content: Am currently staying at this hotel - in London for business and to meet some old friends. I cant say enough about the service - its stellar. Every staff member has treated me like I was the only guest in the hotel - attentive, very polite, accommodating, and very very professional. The hotel itself has no elevator/lift - so if you are not a fan of walking up alot of flights - ask for a room on the 1st/2nd floor. This is my new hotel in London - will most definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not just a hotel - but like a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MetroWoman
Reviews.Content: Stumbled upon this little gem of a hotel when looking for hotels in close proximity to the venue where my friends and I were attending a party. The Georgian Townhouse roots and all the charm of the property have been retained, whist being combined with the comfort and contemporary style of modern day living. From the moment we crossed the threshold and were so warmly greeted, we felt as if we'd come home. The staff were very courteous and helpful. Every member of staff encountered within the hotel smiled at and acknowledged the guests. So refreshing to come across people who really care about their guests and so very obviously take a pride in providing great service in order to enhance the guest's experience. Many of the "big boys" in the hotel business could learn a thing or two from Montagu Place. We booked a "Fancy" room on the top floor which was bright and spacious, tasefully decorated and very quiet. The shower room was quite dinky, (ie small but perfectly formed) but we were happy to see space sacrificed in the bathroom in order to allow for a seating area in the bedroom as was the case here. We loved this hotel, would definitely stay again and would highly reccommend this establishment. Thanks also to the GM who, when we were checking out, gave us an excellent lunch venue recommedation to a nearby gastropub. This topped off our experience. Well done Montagu Place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: MicheleSomerset
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for one night in a Swanky room at the front of the hotel on the 2nd floor. The staff, led by manager Dimitrius, were excellent: friendly, attentive and professional. The room was spacious, the bathroom beautiful (huge bath, separate shower cubicle and two basins) and both were spotlessly clean. The location is excellent, just off Baker Street and we will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to be back!”
Reviews.Author: KerenISL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montagu Place Hotel for 3 nights in early June. The hotel is in a PERFECT location - on a quiet street, minutes away from Oxford street, Hyde Park & 2 tube stations - couldn't ask for a better location. Our room was in the "basement" floor, quiet, tidy and clean. Although we took the Comfy room (I believe it's the smallest of the 3 room types offered), we had plenty of room for our huge suitcases (and all the shopping bags...). The bathroom was small but efficient, the Molton Brown toiletries (I hope that's the correct term) were really nice, as were the bottles of water & the cafetiere. There's also free WiFi with a good connectivity & a nice size flat screen TV. My only remark is the room & bathroom could use a bit of fresh paint... In short - good value for your money, definitely check it out if you're planning a trip to London. I know we'd love to stay there next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ANDREADOG
Reviews.Content: A lovely and very comfortable place to stay in a charming historic building. The staff was very nice and the room was very spacious. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: GB51
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week of the Royal wedding when London was kind of crazy. We had a booking snafu that was mostly my fault, so we ended up 1 night in comfy room with a double bed and 4 in a much more spacious fancy room with a queen bed and 2 large windows facing the street. It's worth the extra money. The manager prides the hotel on its service and he worked hard to accomodate us. He also gave us great reataurant recommendations in the neighborhood. The Polish staff was excellent and very nice and friendly as well. The rooms were nice and modern, but not as luxurious as other 4* hotels where we've stayed. The bathroom was tiny, but we asked for the one with a shower and no tub. The location is quiet, but close to a lot of things. The bus stops about 100 meters from the door and the tube is a 5 minute walk. The hotel will flag a taxi in 5 minutes, easy. Breakfast was very nice and worth the cost to us. Breads, freash fruit, cereals, cold meats and cheeses, juices, coffee & tea plus they will cook eggs to order. If you like small hotels and don't care about the amenities you won't go wrong here. It's not cheap (of course the $ sucks these days) but I think it's reasonable for what you get and the location in London. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DocPat1
Reviews.Content: A renovated historical building, this boutique hotel was a real find for us. Situated in lovely Marleybone, the hotel offers luxury comfort and professional service. In particular, both Dimitrius (the manager) and Michael (who worked the desk) provided us with all the amenities and service you would ever want or need. To begin, Michael opened the door when we arrived, took care of our bags, and served us wine at the desk/bar. We had a bad experience at a previous hotel in Paris, so we were struck by the contrast of all this hotel had to offer. Dimitrius couldn't have been more gracious and lovely. Michael was just as accommodating. We felt like we had arrived! We could have stayed longer, engaging in conversation with Michael and Dimitrius. WARMTH may be the best word to describe both of these individuals and the hotel itself. Requesting a cab to take us to the Globe Theater, Dimitrius walked out of the hotel, walked down the street, and hailed us a cab. He had to "ride" with the cab driver back to the hotel to pick us up. Even the cab driver, Tony, was amazed at what a nice guy Dimitrius was. Now how many managers do you know who would go to such lengths -- and that was only the beginning. We highly recommend the Montagu Place Hotel, and we look forward to our return visit.

Reviews.Title: “found my favourite hotel in london!”
Reviews.Author: PushingTheSenses
Reviews.Content: the perfect boutique hotel in london, conveniently located to both baker street tube and marylebone train station. as a hiltonhonors gold member i am usually trying to stay in a hilton for free wifi and lounge access. my luck this wasn’t possible the last time i was in london! the staff are wonderful – i have rarely experienced such attention. when shown to my room, my mobile in my bag gave this ‘my-battery-is-running-on-empty’ whine, and i was immediately asked whether i needed a charger! upon checkout, i was offered tea and coffee while waiting for my transport, and asked for any comments and suggestions for improvement. for the first time in over 20 years of extensive traveling, i had the feeling that here was someone who was genuinely interested in feedback! liked: everything: the room, the style, the friendliness of the staff disliked: there was absolutely nothing to dislike!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely hotel with a great personal touch”
Reviews.Author: jillybeans88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last Thursday and I thoroughly recommend it to to anyone. It's very central and yet a reasonably quiet location. The room was especially nice, my thanks to the manager for a great room with a great bath! I found the staff to be extremely polite and that nothing was too much trouble (for any of them). I had only one minor quibble and that was the lighting in the bedroom and bathroom was a little dim. I did mention it to the lady at the desk and she said that they were planning to improve the lighting in the rooms. When the lighting is improved - then the hotel would be perfect for us stay in London again! And thank you!

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: x8mca
Reviews.Content: It's easy to see why this place has so many good reviews and I mainly agree with them. The hotel is in an excellent central position, 10 mins walk from Selfridges or Madam Tussauds for instance. The staff are all very friendly and helpful and I suspect they all work very hard to make the place a success. My room was a 'Fancy' room with a queen size bed. Everything was very clean however the room was small although perfectly well appointed. The shower room was tiny and not particularly well lit. The street at the front of the hotel is quite noisy but I live in the middle of nowhere and may be a bit too sensitive on the subject.. The bottom line is that £180 per night for two people in a comfortable, very clean, room in a central location in London is very good value for money and that's hard to argue with.

Reviews.Title: “A true Gem!”
Reviews.Author: hanif
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at the Montagu Place whilst attending a wedding in oxford circus. This hotel oozes quality throughout, every amenity is of a very high standard. Most of all the service from the hotel personnel was impeccable and their helpfulness seemed very genuine. Can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TodgeProvence_France
Reviews.Content: I can really only echo the comments in the last few reviews. We are in the hospitality business in France and were so pleased we picked this Hotel for a two night stay, the first time we have been tourists in London! (despite living in Surrey for most of our lives! ) It is ideally located, the welcome is great and we were lucky enough to be upgraded (we ere celebrating our 10 th wedding anniversary and a special birthday). Don't go with the big corporates - go for something personal, warm and comfortable where you will be made to feel at home. We will always use it when in London and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect haven in Central London”
Reviews.Author: Carole17
Reviews.Content: I'm a Hilton Gold Card holder and usually stay in one of their hotels because of room upgrades and lounge access. There was no availability so tried Montagu Place - as long as they have rooms free I'll never stay anywhere else! It was perfect. Quiet location but very central and extremely comfortable rooms at the right temperature - how often do you find that in London? The staff were probably the friendliest I've ever encountered. There was a mix up with our booking - more my fault than the hotel's, but the Manager, Demetrios resolved everything. The hotel has no restaurant, but we were recommended an excellent restaurant close by. There is a very comfortable lounge bar. Breakfast was excellent. Real cafetiere coffee in the bedrooms. This hotel can not be faulted. I look forward to my next opportunity to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Renate_and_Rafael
Reviews.Content: In London it's not easy to find a hotel which is ideally located, has a friendly staff, has great and spacious rooms and (very important) is affordable. Most of the time you'll find yourself in a hotel, that is just ok but you'd rather not stay longer than needed and moreover you pay more than it's worth. If you're looking for an amazing, gorgeous and stylish boutique hotel with a great price-value and a lovely and very helpful staff then it's definitely The Montague Place Hotel you should stay at on your next London trip. The perfect hotel: Until now we've stayed two times at the Montagu Place Hotel, once in July last year (for five nights) and a second time just a couple of days ago (from March 16th to March 19th, 2010) after our trip to Barbados. We found this gorgeous hotel thanks to Google and Tripadvisor and we don't have to look any further for another hotel. We've found the perfect hotel and to us it is 100% sure that whenever we'll stay in London on a private basis we'll stay at the Montague Place Hotel. (Unfortunately our employers do book different hotels for the business trips, so we won't be able at the Montagu Place Hotel for business trips :-(!!). The room: As you all might be aware, there are three different kind of room type at Montague, the Comfy, the Fancy and the Swanky rooms. On our first time we chose the Fancy and our second time the Swanky room. We were pleased with both rooms. The only difference between the two room types is the slightly higher price for the Swanky room, the size of the room itself, the bed such as the bathroom/toilet. I must admit we both loved the bathroom in the swanky room! Spacious and very bright plus some nice Molton Brown toiletries (in the other rooms as well). As for the bed, it's just amazing how comfortable a hotel bed can be!!! We had a great and comfortable night-sleep. Breakfast: The breakfast is being served in a nice room next to the lobby. You'll get fresh eggs every morning (scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, fried eggs etc. as you wish) such as coffee, tea, cereals, yoghurt, fruits, water, fresh juices, cheese and cold meat. It's not a luxury breakfast buffet with caviar and salmon but it's perfect. You don't need more on a morning when you afterwards want to discover the town. The quality of the food is very good and fresh! Nothing to add on this. We both always looked forward to the breakfast. Amenities: On a regularly basis there are magazines being delivered to your room such as Cosmopolitan, Elle, The Economist, London Out etc. You can also keep them and read them when you're on your way back home on the airplane. You've got free internet within the whole hotel. You'll get provided with a code for the WLAN and can use the internet as long as you'd like to for the whole length of your stay. Everything in the room is free. There is no minibar in the room but you've got a fridge and you can buy drinks yourself and put it in there. There are water bottles in the room and the equipment to make yourself a tea or a coffee, such as fruits and cookies. All of it is free. When you feel very thirsty the kind hotel employees will provide you with more of it. Location: The hotel is very well located in the area Marleybone. If you come from the airport, the best way to get there is taking the Heathrow express to Paddington and from there a taxi will take you to the hotel within less than 10 minutes. If you arrive at Gatwick, you'll take the Gatwick express until Victoria station and from there you can take a taxi to the hotel which will take you around 15 minutes (with traffic) to the hotel. The hotel is within walking distance to the Paddington station (around 15 to 20 minutes) and from the Baker Street tube station (5 minutes) and from the Marelybone tube station. You can also walk to the Oxford street within 10 minutes. Although the hotel is very central it's situated in a residential area aside a very nice little park. At night it's not at all loud. Outstanding service: The reason, next to the design of the hotel, the rooms and the location, is the outstanding service of the friendly people working at Montague Place. We've never stayed at a Hotel which such a friendly service so far (we've stayed at very expensive hotels where the service was really poor...)!!! It's just amazing!!! The persons working there treat you like friends and are very obliging, friendly, funny, polite and have all the great characteristics you could think of. Some examples: I ordered a clothing item from at home in Switzerland which could only be sent to the UK therefore I asked them whether I could let it send to the hotel and if they then could take care of this item upon my arrival. They told me it would be no problem at all and therefore kept it during 3 weeks in their hotels and when I arrived they just handed it over to me without me even asking for it. Coming from Barbados we arrived very early at the Montagu Place Hotel (around 7.45 in the morning). We were kindly offered some tea and coffee and stayed for a while in the lobby. Went to the bathroom to refresh ourselves a bit after the journey. At 9 o'clock in the morning (!!!) - we were just about to leave for breakfast and wanted to leave the baggage at the reception - we were told the room has now been cleaned already so that we could already move in. We were really positively surprised that someone cleaned it so quickly and we could go to our room already at 9 o'clock in the morning. On our last night I did the web-checkin and as we didn't have printer with us I e-mailed our e-tickets to the reception asking wether they could print it out and hold it ready upon our departure the other morning. After 2 minutes I had an e-mail in my inbox telling me, that the tickets were print out and being brought to my room immediately. What a great service. Every time you passed the reception the staff was smiling at you (a warm smile and no fake smile) and the chatted with you. Very nice. You always felt like coming home and not like coming to an anonymous place. On our last time when we needed a taxi someone even went outside and to the street and called us a taxi. Very kind. Price-value: The price you pay for the Montagu Place Hotel is not cheap but it's 100% worth it's money!!! Quality never is free of charge ;-)!!! But we don't wanna say that it's expensive. It's just perfect price-value. But don't expect it to be cheap. But I guess by reading the above review you'll notice as well the the boutique hotel is a jewel in the big city of London!!! To sum up, we are very very happy that we found that hotel in July last year. We found the perfect location to stay at and we'll never ever look for something else when we come to London. It's of none importance wether you're old or young, a couple or two friends, business travelers or on a private journey --> Montague Place Hotel will please all of you, but only if you look for something special, with overwhelming staff etc. Thank again to the staff of Montagu Place Hotel for our amazing London experience we could live thanks to you!!! See you very soon Renate and Rafael

Reviews.Title: “I only wish I had time to stay longer.”
Reviews.Author: generalaviationpilot
Reviews.Content: Comfortable beds, quiet rooms and excellent location. Staff friendly and considerate.

Reviews.Title: “Pristine Rooms with Style, Great Staff and a Quiet, but Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Sarnia G
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at Montagu Place in early February 2011, having spent much time browsing the reviews here on Tripadvisor. Once again, they didn't let me down! The greeting on arrival was warm and friendly and I was given a choice of room (I'd booked a "comfy" room, which has a double 4'6" bed) and shown how everything (heating, etc) worked. Bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean and freshly styled. Nice touches: complimentary bottled water, cafetiere coffee and choice of teas in the bedroom, plus Molton Brown toiletries in the bathroom. Great to have a proper hairdryer! I moved rooms the 2nd night of my stay, as I was unexpectedly joined by an elderly relative, and the only room left was on the 4th (top) floor - 65 steps up. Yes, I actually counted them! Note that because the hotel is in a listed building, there is no lift so if you have problems climbing stairs, ask for a room on a lower floor. My "swanky" room on the 2nd night was gorgeous! Very spacious, with a beautiful bathroom and deluxe range of Molton Brown toiletries. I only wish I'd had more time to enjoy the room. Location is good: 10 minutes walk (maximum) from Oxford Street, but in a relatively quiet area within walking distance also of Marylebone High Street. I did have to explain to three taxi drivers exactly where the hotel was located as they hadn't heard of it, so I recommend you print out the map that comes with the email confirmation from the hotel, or, tell them to drive north out of Portman Square onto Gloucester Place and take 2nd left turn at traffic lights onto Montagu Place. Hotel is just on the right! Price is very good for a central London Hotel, and I'm sure I'll be staying at Montagu Place again.

Reviews.Title: “Extra touches really make the difference - a really lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: RicardoRich
Reviews.Content: A lovely and smart little hotel in a nice part of London. Stylishly furnished and immaculately kept, one of the biggest selling points of the hotel is the great service you get from the exceptionally friendly staff. We were given complimentary coffee - without even asking for it! - as we used our laptops (free wifi!) in the very comfortable lounge. The rooms are great - we were in a very spacious ground floor room. The area is nice and quiet, just off the main road, so it's very quiet and you get a good night's sleep. The bath was a little small, but this didn't matter as the shower was great. What we loved were the special little extra touches, like Molton Brown toiletries in the bathrooms - a real treat. We enjoyed a fantastic meal from room service - the hotel has partnered up with a local Thai restaurant to offer hot food, and this was just delicious. And again, the service was absolutely excellent - meal brought to our room within 20 minutes of ordering. Oxford Street and all of its shops are just a 10 minute walk round the corner and straight down the road. With Baker Street and Marylebone Tube Stations very close by, the whole of London is really accessible from this hotel too. Would definitely return in future - highly recommended for an extra special stay in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: GinNorway
Reviews.Content: With all of these great reviews, I really wanted to adore this hotel. Maybe my expectations were a little out of line because for the price, this really is a great hotel in comparison to a lot of other hotels in London. I just want to give an honest review, so you can know what to expect. Room: We stayed in room 21- a "Comfy" room (the smallest of the 3 types) with a double bed and shower. It is to my knowledge that not all rooms come with a shower..some come with only a bathtub (so make sure you request). Modern furnishings were nice, but the room was very cramped with a huge, bulky desk smashed up next to the bed. Carpet was looking a little worn and I would have much prefered hard wood flooring for a more modern feel. Floor was very uneven that I thought maybe I had too much to drink. LOL. But some people might consider that charming! The room is starting to look worn and could probably use a coat of fresh paint (luggage marks on the wall). I noticed some grime in the crevices of the bathroom floor near the shower, which was a little disappointing. We did enjoy the luxury toiletries. The TV was a small, flat screen with few channels. We did appreciate that it was a very quiet room, and we heard no noise from adjacent rooms or from the street. But, we slept poorly because the bed was small and hard. I never get back aches from sleeping, but I did for the 2 nights we were here. If we stay here again, I would upgrade to a bigger room, and hopefully it comes with a bigger bed! Service: We were welcomed promptly and our room was ready before the standard check in time, which was very nice. The staff was polite and friendly but not intrusive. If you are curious about something, ask them and they will be more than willing to help. We got a great restaurant recommendation (Hunter 486 at the Arch Hotel). We chose not to eat breakfast at the hotel and that was just fine, due to all of the options just a short walk away. Amenities: Free Wi-Fi was great! We wish they would have had a gym, but apparently they give out gym passes to a place which is within walking distance. Location: Loved the location in a quiet, safe neighborhood within short walking distance to the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LarsKimo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so perfect. We arrived 9th Dec, and checked out 12th Dec. Perfect accommodations for a couple to spend their holiday in London. Breakfast is not superior, but with cheese, ham, fresh bakery and fruits its all you need. They will also make you scrambled or boiled egg. Rooms were nice, clean and very quiet.. 2 minutes walk distance from the bus, and a short 10 min walk from Oxford street.

Reviews.Title: “Very Salubrious”
Reviews.Author: chris_db
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Excellent reception staff and very welcoming. Room is not large but very well appointed with a lovely bathroom (underfloor heating). Breakfast is pretty low key, no fry up! Make sure to ask for two tea bags if you like proper tea Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, excellent staff, made my trip spectacular”
Reviews.Author: cmtaylor
Reviews.Content: I should have written this up earlier (and just had to re-register to do so), but it slipped my mind, which isn't at all fair to this wonderful hotel. I was stuck in London for a week when the Icelandic volcano decided to act up, and the Montagu - and it's truly wonderful staff - saved me. The hotel and its staff are exceptional (I travel internationally for business a large percentage of my time, and this place stands out!). I recommend it without reservation. The hotel booked by the people I met with tripled the room rates because (as far as I can tell) they could get away with it, and I decided I'd rather sleep in the train station than get gouged. Luckily, I googled first and the Montagu came up, and when I called them to ask about availability the gentleman who answered was amazingly helpful - I moved hotels that afternoon. I had several enjoyable conversations with the staff at the little bar (of which the main desk is a part), and everyone did all they could to make my extra time in London effective. On top of the little french press and coffee in my room (standard, and a huge relief after the more common packets of instant coffee) and the included wireless internet, they did my laundry so that I could get through my unexpected additional week, they pointed me to good local coffee houses and lunch spots, and generally went out of their ways to make sure that I was comfortable and felt well-looked after (and I did). Everyone else in my working group who was also stranded was very jealous (yes, I gloated). The rooms (I was in a neat attic room) are pleasant, the beds very comfortable, and everything was mostly well-kempt (they were apparently touching up the hallways the next week) and clean (the only 5 I've ever given for cleanliness was a German hotel that glistened). The hotel is off the Bakerloo stop, not too far, and the walk to Imperial through the park is pleasant in good weather. The place can be a bit pricy if you're on a tight budget, or even on an expense account. I was lucky and got a good deal, and then -- when they found out about my first hotel's behavior -- they made it even better. That personal recognition of client stresses is what makes a hotel (or any service) stand out, and Montagu, under Demitrios' excellent captainship, does so in spades. I really can't recommend this place enough. I look forward to the opportunity to go back and visit them sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant little hotel if you can book it”
Reviews.Author: SimonButcher
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite a find, not too far from Baker Street tube station, walking distance from Oxford Street. Friendly staff and cozy little rooms! Be warned, there's no elevator and the stairs are quite pokey, but that doesn't bother me at all.

Reviews.Title: “Montagu Place Hotel - very special hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: travelca2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Montagu Place hotel in London for 2 nights in September. This small hotel is super clean and the staff is incredibly warm and friendly -- caring without being intrusive. We arrived at the hotel earlier than expected and while our room was being readied, the staff offered us hot coffee and tea -- a lovely touch given that we had been traveling for 14 plus hours. The hotel is in a very quiet location but close to transportation with easy access to different parts of the city. The breakfast was delicious with lots of variety. We can't say enough good things about the Montagu other than we would defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in Central London”
Reviews.Author: ashleye54
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 10 days in London, all of which was spent staying at the Montagu Place Hotel. I did a pretty exhaustive round of research on Central London hotels and this one seemed to have it all: great reviews, reasonable prices at the 4 star level, boutique-style/quaint and served breakfast. So I booked it, and was very glad I did! Note: if you prefer larger, chain hotels, this isn't for you. It's only 16 rooms, set in a townhouse and there are no workout facilities, as well as their room service is a local thai restaurant (not from their own kitchen). They do serve breakfast and have tea service through the day though, as well as laundry service. My main purpose of the trip was business, but I also stayed two weekends to site see, with my boyfriend joining me halfway through. It was important to me to not be in a cramped space, like so many European hotel rooms can be. Upon booking, I saw that only their smallest "Comfy" room was available, so I put a note asking to be placed in a larger room if one became available. About a week later, the manager, Dimitrios, called me personally stating that it I could be be moved into their Swanky deluxe room for only £30 more per night. Sold!! I also pre-bought breakfast daily for £10/day as apposed to £14 you would pay at the hotel. My arrival was easy as I had pre-arranged a car service from Heathrow through the hotel. It cost £58, but was worth it to me not knowing the London area whatsoever. I was checked in to my room right away, number 32, and was glad to see it looked like what I had saw on their website. Huge bed and a divine bathroom, complete with a big tub. I knew I'd be comfortable here for 10 days. Overall the service of the hotel is excellent: every single person that works there is helpful and kind. They remember who you are and don't try to slip in hidden charges on the bill. The location is fantastic, a couple blocks from the Baker Street Tube station, or Oxford Street, but in a quiet residential area. The breakfast is an assortment of rolls, mini cheeses, meats, yogurt, juice, and cereal--complete with eggs made to order and fresh coffee or tea. I ate there for 10 days in a row and didn't tire of it! I would 100% stay here again, and probably will, as I will have to return often for business.

Reviews.Title: “A top notch experience all around. I will...”
Reviews.Author: worldtour2000
Reviews.Content: A top notch experience all around. I will definitely stay again. I felt at home from the moment I arrived. The room was a decent size, by European standards, and very comfortable and well-appointed. Wifi was free, easy, and accessible all throughout the townhouse. There was complimentary bottles water, tea, coffee, and cookies in the room. The breakfast was delicious and included meats, breads, cereals, eggs and toast cooked per request, and a large ppt of coffee brought to table with cream and sugar on table (many hotels don't do this and make you get up for it or flag someone down to find it). The breakfast room was lovely and the service warm, friendly, and attentive. The hotel staff assiste me with some business needs (faxing, etc.) for no extra charge, and they found me a last-minute ticket to a popular show, booked it for me, and the tickets were waiting for me at the theater. The neighborhood is quiet, peaceful, easy walking distance to the Baker Street tube station and Marlyebone street shops, and a quick walk to Oxford street. Overall a fantastic stay and I'm looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel with attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: tibblesb
Reviews.Content: As the title says, this is a lovely boutique hotel, set on the corner of a very pretty garden square in central London. The style and feel of the hotel is of an elegant townhouse - and the staff are incredibly helpful and courteous so it feels a bit like staying in a friend's very lovely house. The room (their cheapest) that we stayed in was a good size and beautifully appointed. It was the small details that really impressed me though: a selection of glossy magazines in the bedrooms, 100ml molton brown shower gel in the bathroom, cafetiere coffee. It's also good value for this part of London.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE IN GREAT LOCATION....PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: fi3996
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers the best of both worlds in terms of location as it is situated in a quiet residential area, yet so close to Baker St, Marylebone and Oxford St. I chose the hotel because of Trip Advisor reviews and I was not disappointed. I stayed in a "comfy" double room with my 13 year old daughter. The room had characater, was tastefully decorated and was more spacious than some London hotel rooms. We had Molton Brown products, filter coffee and bottles of water in the room. The room (number 1) was underneath reception, but there were no noise problems at all...the manager Dimitri stated they have recently invested in improved sound proofing; in actual fact, the hotel is wonderfully calm and tranquil! Breakfast was continental with good quality produce, and my daughter enjoyed wonderful scrambled eggs, freshly made smoothies and hot chocolate. Nothing was too much trouble for the hotel staff; I was blown away by how lovely they all are. We booked directly with the hotel and the price for the room and breakfast was a real bargain; given the quality of the accomodation and the overall experience. The hotel allowed us to check in early on arrival, and kept our bags after check out which allowed us to continue sightseeing. The service at this hotel is excellent; a perfect mix of attentive but unobtrusive. Thank you so much to everyone at the Montagu Place..you made our trip to London even more special!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SaraBrussels
Reviews.Content: After having written a (bad) review about another hotel in London (Holiday Inn) I suddenly remembered having stayed at the charming Montagu Place Hotel last year. So here is a small (but late) review... We spent two nights with our kids and had two connecting rooms. We had a superior room with a fantastic bathroom (huge)! The service was personal (very small hotel) and the breakfast was good (don't expect a huge buffet breakfast). This is a very romantic place but is also a great place for business travellers. I would perhaps not go with our teenager kids any more. The hotel is well located (walking distance from Oxford Street).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: zades11
Reviews.Content: Very kind staff, always aiming to help and make you feel home. My compliments to Dimitri, the director that has satisfied all our requests never loosing his smile and courtesy. The hotel is located in a great position, just behind Oxford street and few steps form Marble Arch tube. Nice decor of the rooms and big enough to be in London. Excellent breakfast à la carte.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly service - Small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mehdi_Meghdadi
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you don't have sophisticated requirements. It's like staying at a friend's big house. You'll benefit from a nice central location while you still enjoy a quiet neighborhood. Good if you're flying in/out of Heathrow and taking the Express to Paddington. The guy at the reception was really nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem of a hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Melordy
Reviews.Content: I loved this very small and elegant hotel. The location just a ten minute walk from Oxford Street - Selfridges was perfect. The rooms are well appointed with a luxurious feel to them. It made for a lovely relaxing stay, as there was none of the hassle & buzzle you get in the bigger London hotels. The hotel has a townhouse home away from home feel to it. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “boutique hotel with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: latte_fan
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Montagu Place over Easter weekend. After arriving on a very early morning flight the hotel staff kindly did their best to let me check in as soon as possible. They took and stored my luggage, gave me excellent walking directions to the British Museum, and told me the room would be ready at noon. With three hours to kill I walked to the Museum, had a snack at coffee shop, and true to their word my room was ready at noon. The staff had already taken my bags to the room -- nice touch of personal service. The two staff members I meet during my stay were friendly, professional, and eager to help with any request or question that came up. I didn't feel like just another guest, they made me feel like their only guest. The hotel property itself is in a good location in the Marylebone neighborhood, easy walking distance to Oxford Street (Selfridges, John Lewis, and tons of shopping options), Hyde Park (Speaker's Corner), Park Lane, Regent's Park, Madame Tussard's, and the Baker Street Tube station. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. I had a double on the second floor (up one flight of stairs). The room was on the back side of the hotel so traffic noise wasn't an issue. The bed was heavenly, firm and supportive, plenty of pillows, and a nice soft duvet to keep me warm. The bathroom was spacious, shower stall big enough for two, and lovely Molton Brown toiletries. I liked having the in room coffee/tea service, free bottled water, and delicious gingerbread cookies -- perfect bedtime snack. There is also free Wi-Fi throughout the property. Excellent service, comfortable rooms, and reasonable rates make the Montagu Place good value for money. Just a tip -- If you're arriving in London via Heathrow the Paddington express train will have you in the city in about twenty minutes. Taxi service from Paddington station to the hotel was around ten pounds.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: EK103
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. We had a large room (nr 33, up quite a lot of stairs!) which was decorated in a contemporary style but had an old fireplace and an uneven floor that you get in old houses. The room and bathroom were spotless and the hotel was very quiet. Only 5 minutes walk to Baker Street tube station. Molton Brown toiletries in the bathroom were an unexpected treat! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bilboa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Montague Hotel for one night with our 9 year old and 14 year old. Had interconnecting rooms as they could not accommodate us all in one. Our children had a standard double and we had a 'Swanky' room. I have to say at this stage that it is well worth paying a bit extra for a better room as the 'comfy' room was very small and so was the bathroom. Our 'Swanky' room however was more spacious with 2 lots of french doors and 2 small balconies. The bathroom was lovely - light and spacious with french doors and a balcony too. The rooms were clean although a little more attention could have been paid to the doors and windows which were quite dirty and marked. The reception staff were helpful and pleasant . Noise from the road at night was minimal. The hotel itself is in a good position. We booked it because our daughters wanted to go to Madame Tussauds and wanted to be within walking distance. We also walked to Oxford Street which was not too far. The only thing that I have to say that probably let it down slightly was the breakfast. It was basic and the member of staff not so friendly. We waited ages for coffee and scrambled eggs. No one came round to see if everything was ok or if we would have liked anything else. Overall slightly poor. All in all we liked this hotel.
